posts.title: Mastering HTML5 Semantics
posts.body: Using semantic HTML improves accessibility, SEO, and code clarity. Elements like <article>, <section>, and <aside> help browsers and assistive tech understand page structure.

posts.title: CSS Grid vs Flexbox: When to Use Each
posts.body: Both Flexbox and Grid are powerful layout systems in CSS. Grid is ideal for two-dimensional layouts, while Flexbox shines in one-dimensional arrangements.

posts.title: Node.js Crash Course for Beginners
posts.body: Node.js allows JavaScript to run on the server, enabling backend development with the same language used on the frontend. It's great for building fast and scalable network apps.

posts.title: Understanding Vue 3 Composition API
posts.body: Vue 3 introduces the Composition API, which offers a more flexible way to organize logic inside components. It allows developers to group related code by feature, making components easier to maintain.

posts.title: Getting Started with JavaScript ES6
posts.body: ES6 brought many improvements to JavaScript, including arrow functions, template literals, destructuring, and modules. These features make your code cleaner and more powerful.

posts.title: Why You Should Learn Git and GitHub
posts.body: Version control is an essential skill for developers. Git allows you to track code changes, while GitHub helps you collaborate with others and contribute to open source projects.

posts.title: Building Responsive Layouts with CSS Flexbox
posts.body: Flexbox is a CSS layout module that makes it easy to design flexible and responsive layout structures. It's especially useful for aligning elements in a row or column, even when their size is unknown.
